image.altText: Man stands and looks at camera in a dairy shed.

props.synopsis: Some South Australian farmers say they are still feeling the strain of drought after inconsistent winter rains left little room for recovery before the coming summer.

title.children: South Australian farmers 'on knife edge' ahead of summer after a year of dry conditions

image.altText: A cricket player in white with blue helmet walks off holding bat with celebrating players behind him

props.synopsis: Australia's incumbent Test opener Sam Konstas is dropped and survives two LBW appeals before being dismissed for four on day one of the Sheffield Shield.

title.children: Sam Konstas among Ashes hopefuls to fail on day one of Sheffield Shield

image.altText: Smokey sunset over the water at Coolum Beach QLD in October

props.synopsis: Southern and eastern Australia are forecast to see a surge of summer-like warmth, as high fire danger warnings are issued across several parts of the country.

title.children: BOM forecasts summer heat to make way for cold switch

image.altText: Four women in identical cycling gear raise a red quad tandem bike to their shoulders.

props.synopsis: Four ladies are baffling bike shop mechanics, riding a custom-made quad tandem bike across Australia for charity.

title.children: Heads turn during Australia's first transcontinental quad tandem bike ride

image.altText: Marine scientist Mike Steer.

props.synopsis: The face of South Australia's algal bloom response says the natural event "is not going to ruin summer" and he is looking forward to spending more time with his kids at the beach.

title.children: SA's algal bloom chief keen to hit the beach this summer

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: A week of large-scale land and air searches have found no clues leading to the whereabouts of four-year-old Gus in outback South Australia.

title.children: Why the search for a missing 4yo in SA's outback was so challenging

image.altText: A sign outside disability support service Bedford.

props.synopsis: Australia's second-largest disability employment provider Bedford will be kept afloat by a $4.4 million federal government funding injection as it seeks a buyer for the embattled business.

title.children: More funds announced to keep Bedford afloat as hunt for buyer continues

image.altText: a picture of a river bordered by trees looking towards the horizon on a clear day.

props.synopsis: An algal bloom causing toxic foam and fish kills along South Australia's beaches prompts holiday-makers to consider alternative summer travel plans.

title.children: Holiday-makers swap the beach for the river to avoid algal bloom

image.altText: A mum wearing a pink shirt, sitting with her two children.

props.synopsis: Parents rely on after-school care to be able to participate in the workforce, but in one country SA town, the only provider's future is unclear.

title.children: After-school care closure crisis leaves parents scrambling

image.altText: Police officers standing at the door to a supermarket and scanning a man

props.synopsis: Three Adelaide shopping centres are among the latest sites where police can search for knives.

title.children: Police given powers to search for knives at three new shopping centres

image.altText: A photo of Chris Robertson whose death is being treated as murder.

props.synopsis: The death of Chris Robertson, whose body was found at an industrial site in Adelaide's south on Tuesday, is now being treated as a major crime, police say.

title.children: Murder investigation launched after father-of-two's body found at Adelaide industrial site

image.altText: Brown foam on the shores of Glenelg.

props.synopsis: Brown foam has blanketed one of the state's most popular tourist beaches in South Australia, as the state government launches an algal bloom hotline.

title.children: Foam blankets Glenelg beach as government launches algal bloom hotline

image.altText: The Adelaide CBD viewed from the air looking down on West Terrace

props.synopsis: Adelaide's lord mayor is confident the city will be prepared to host the event, even though it is 13 months away and Australia remains in a deadlock over hosting rights.

title.children: ‘We will deliver’: Adelaide defiant on COP31 despite host city delay

image.altText: A surfer balancing on a board on a wave.

props.synopsis: The disastrous algal bloom that has been lapping at South Australia's shores has turned a coastline into a frontline, leaving many swimmers, surfers and seaside business operators wondering what the upcoming summer will look like.

title.children: The sea is sick and has entered uncharted waters

image.altText: A floating structure attached to a type of bridge connecting two bodies of water in an outback area, as seen from above.

props.synopsis: A fish passage that connects the Darling River with Lake Wetherell in order to redistribute native fish is being trialled with the aim of preventing more ecological disasters.

title.children: AI deployed in bid to prevent more mass fish deaths in outback NSW

image.altText: The home of the Adelaide Lightning WNBL club.

props.synopsis: Four investors, including Drakes grocery chain owner John Paul Drake and entrepreneur Mohan Koo, have bought a 30-per-cent stake in the women's basketball team.

title.children: Adelaide Lightning bought by group of SA investors after government lifeline

image.altText: SA Police officer pointing at a screen with with a counterfeit fifty dollar note

props.synopsis: SA Police says there have been more than 200 reported cases of counterfeit currency being used in the state in the past two months.

title.children: SA Police issue fake currency warning after more than 200 incidents in past two months

image.altText: A cricket team with red caps and white shirts poses for a photo with a big trophy shield

props.synopsis: South Australia is looking to repeat its success and win the Sheffield Shield title, after a decade-breaking win last season.

title.children: SA ready to repeat drought-breaking success from last season

image.altText: illustration of a judge in a red cape and wig with face a screen of mathematical symbols

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is coming for the law. Are we ready for robots to become judge and jury?

title.children: Lawyers are already using AI. Will judges be next?

image.altText: An oil painting showing fields and a reaper

props.synopsis: A "rarely seen" collection of works from renowned artists Vincent van Gogh, Claude Monet and Henri Matisse will be on display in Adelaide next year, as part of 57 works on loan from the Toledo Museum of Art in the US.

title.children: Van Gogh painting to be displayed in Adelaide for first time

image.altText: Sean Diddy Combs looking at something with sunglasses on

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs may have just been sentenced to four years in prison, but he still faces a mountain of lawsuits accusing him of sexual violence and other misconduct.

title.children: Here's what's next for Sean 'Diddy' Combs now he's been sentenced to four years in prison

image.altText: Reece Walsh takes a shot at goal during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Kick-off times, pre-game entertainment and all the players taking the field. Here's everything you need to know for grand final day in Sydney.

title.children: What time are the NRL and NRLW grand finals?

image.altText: Andrew Hastie speaks in a corridor in Parliament House

props.synopsis: Hastie says he decided to quit because a letter she sent him earlier in the week made clear he wouldn't be formulating the Coalition's immigration policies.

title.children: Andrew Hastie’s resignation could not be worse timing for Sussan Ley

image.altText: A blue metal train carriage exterior surrounded by charred broken wood and with orange flames and smoke seen through a window

props.synopsis: A Russian drone strike has hit a passenger train in Ukraine's northern Sumy region and injured dozens of people in an act President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has denounced as 'terrorism'.

title.children: Russian strike hits Ukrainian passenger train, authorities say

image.altText: A close-up shot of a man with an ecstatic expression.

props.synopsis: The party of billionaire and self-declared "Trumpist" Andrej Babiš wins the Czech Republic's parliamentary election, near-final results show, which could steer the country away from supporting Ukraine.

title.children: Populist billionaire Andrej Babiš wins Czech parliamentary election

image.altText: gas flares from pipes in the air

props.synopsis: The Browse gas project is staring down the full weight of Australia's climate movement. Analysts say that is the least of its worries.

title.children: Financial analysts cast doubt on mega Woodside gas project

image.altText: A woman with a dog standing next to a placard saying a home is for sale.

props.synopsis: Councillors say they recognise that small housing is needed to meet housing demand, but state government support will be needed to build key infrastructure.

title.children: Smaller homes in demand during regional housing crunch

image.altText: Tom in a blue suit behind a podium with a shocked face. Hard Quiz Kids logo in the top right corner

props.synopsis: I find it interesting you think you could beat the know-it-all tweens on Hard Quiz Kids. How about you prove it? Let's play, HARD!

title.children: Are these pipsqueaks smarter than you? Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: A man helps a woman down from the window of a badly-damaged building, with smoke rising around

props.synopsis: Ali Jadallah's photo, called Leaving Home, shows three people emerging from the rubble of their damaged building.

title.children: See all the winners from the Siena Awards Photo Festival

image.altText: A group of rugby players wrestle for the ball in wet conditions

props.synopsis: Australia's hopes of an unlikely Rugby Championship triumph have been extinguished with a 28-14 loss to New Zealand.

title.children: Professional All Blacks outclass Wallabies at wet and wild Perth Stadium

image.altText: A man wearing dark blue police uniform

props.synopsis: While Premier Jacinta Allan narrows in on machetes and bail laws, Chief Commissioner Mike Bush is looking to broader horizons as Victoria witnesses record levels of offending.

title.children: Victoria's police chief is forging his own path to fight record crime

image.altText: Soccer players in red and blue celebrate scoring a goal

props.synopsis: The Newcastle Jets have defeated semi-professional club Heidelberg United 3-1 to claim their first silverware since 2008.

title.children: Jets down Heidelberg to win Australia Cup

image.altText: Oscar Piastri holds a small microphone up towards George Russell as the pair chat.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri pronounces himself satisfied after finishing third in qualifying to gain an advantage over fifth-placed teammate Lando Norris at the Singapore GP.

title.children: Piastri satisfied with advantage over Norris in Singapore qualifying

image.altText: A lady with short black hair sitting in-front of a microphone

props.synopsis: The decision comes after the Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announced his resignation last month.

title.children: Sanae Takaichi likely to become Japan's first female PM
